item.title: TokHaar-Kal (release)
item.dc:creator: @harusakura1 harusakura1
item.description:
@harusakura1 wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:23, topic:435226”][quote author=kingman002 link=topic=537945.msg4036296#msg4036296 date=1341245487]
I’m going to attempt to resize it for a 317 character model
[/quote]

All you need to do is lower it down a bit, the cape part that goes around your neck ends up being at your chin with 317 character models.

Also

Yeah so… I added it But. You can see it through the body and it equips in your weapon slot. Please Help.

Go to your source folder…
Open up Item.
Search for Cape and add the code there!
If you dont understand go to youtube/google.

What the fuck are you talking about.
To fix that, open Model.java and replace public Model with this:

public Model(int modelId) {
	byte[] is = aClass21Array1661[modelId].aByteArray368;
	if (is[is.length - 1] == -1 && is[is.length - 2] == -1)
		read622Model(is, modelId);
	else
		readOldModel(modelId);
	if (newmodel[modelId]) {
		scale2(4);// 2 is too big -- 3 is almost right
		if(anIntArray1638 != null) {
			for(int j = 0; j < anIntArray1638.length; j++)
				anIntArray1638[j] = 10;
		}
	}
}

All credit for that goes to 'Spike on Rune-Server.[/quote]

I don’t have a model.java. Now what? Also my item.java is like

public static boolean playerCape(int itemId) { String[] data = { "cloak", "cape", "Cape", "attractor", "Attractor", "Ava's", "TokHaar-Kal", "TokHaar", "Tok" }; String item = getItemName(itemId); if (item == null) { return false; } boolean item1 = false; for(int i = 0; i < data.length; i++ ) { if(item.endsWith(data[i]) || item.contains(data[i])) { item1 = true; } } return item1; }

I have put the Tok and TokHaar there too but it still holds in his hands…

Read full topic

item.title: TokHaar-Kal (release)
item.dc:creator: @DessertSun DessertSun
item.description:
@DessertSun wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:23, topic:435226”][quote author=kingman002 link=topic=537945.msg4036296#msg4036296 date=1341245487]
I’m going to attempt to resize it for a 317 character model
[/quote]

All you need to do is lower it down a bit, the cape part that goes around your neck ends up being at your chin with 317 character models.

Also

Yeah so… I added it But. You can see it through the body and it equips in your weapon slot. Please Help.

Go to your source folder…
Open up Item.
Search for Cape and add the code there!
If you dont understand go to youtube/google.

What the fuck are you talking about.
To fix that, open Model.java and replace public Model with this:

public Model(int modelId) {
	byte[] is = aClass21Array1661[modelId].aByteArray368;
	if (is[is.length - 1] == -1 && is[is.length - 2] == -1)
		read622Model(is, modelId);
	else
		readOldModel(modelId);
	if (newmodel[modelId]) {
		scale2(4);// 2 is too big -- 3 is almost right
		if(anIntArray1638 != null) {
			for(int j = 0; j < anIntArray1638.length; j++)
				anIntArray1638[j] = 10;
		}
	}
}

All credit for that goes to 'Spike on Rune-Server.[/quote]

Because i did this and it worked :o

Read full topic

[/quote]

Go to your source folder…
Open up Item.
Search for Cape and add the code there!
If you dont understand go to youtube/google.[/quote]

What the fuck are you talking about.
To fix that, open Model.java and replace public Model with this:

public Model(int modelId) {
	byte[] is = aClass21Array1661[modelId].aByteArray368;
	if (is[is.length - 1] == -1 && is[is.length - 2] == -1)
		read622Model(is, modelId);
	else
		readOldModel(modelId);
	if (newmodel[modelId]) {
		scale2(4);// 2 is too big -- 3 is almost right
		if(anIntArray1638 != null) {
			for(int j = 0; j < anIntArray1638.length; j++)
				anIntArray1638[j] = 10;

}

All credit for that goes to 'Spike on Rune-Server.

item.dc:creator: @totalystylin1 totalystylin1
item.description:
@totalystylin1 wrote:

[quote=“infinitymagic, post:1, topic:435226”]I do not claim any rights for me on this!

http://www.mediafire.com/?g9umjzd13e3n881 //This are the models!

[code]case 19111:
itemDef.name =“TokHaar-Kal”;

			itemDef.value = 60000;
			itemDef.anInt165 = 62575;
			itemDef.anInt200 = 62582;
			itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
			itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take";
			itemDef.modelOffset1 = -4;
			itemDef.modelid = 62592;
			itemDef.stackable = false;
			itemDef.description = "A cape made of ancient, enchanted obsidian.";
			itemDef.modelZoom = 2086;
			itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
			itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";
			itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop";
			itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;
			itemDef.modelRotationY = 533;
			itemDef.modelRotationX = 333;
			break;[/code]

I hope everyone will like this ;)[/quote]

Nice
